title: Arsenal fans fear the worst after Alexis Sanchez posts ‘broken heart’ message
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL fans have begged Alexis Sanchez to stay after he posted a cryptic “broken heart” message on Instagram. 
The Chilean star sparked anxious replies after he wrote: “Strong people smile with a broken heart. They cry with the doors closed and fight battles that no one knows.” A photo posted by Alexis Sanchez (@alexis_officia1) on Jan 19, 2017 at 9:26am PST 
“They cry with the doors closed and fight battles that no one knows…!!” 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Supporters reckoned it may be proof he wants to quit the Emirates — but it is thought the message was for his cousin, who recently died from a brain tumour in their homeland at the age of just 43. 
It is understood the two were close and Juan Sanchez had visited Alexis in London. 
However, the player’s emotional outcry on his official Instagram page came on the day manager Arsene Wenger admitted Arsenal cannot match the phenomenal £400,000-a-week wages the frontman is being offered in China. 
Supporters responded by pleading with him to stay at the Gunners, with some claiming the message was “100 per cent” proof he wants to leave. Getty Images 2 Arsene Wenger gives Alexis Sanchez instructions during Arsenal training 
Sanchez, who has just 18 months left on his contract, has stalled on signing a new one following the offer to move to Manuel Pellegrini’s Hebei China Fortune. 
He would pocket three times his Emirates salary. 
Wenger admitted: “The danger we face is that the offers from China become the benchmark for Europe and we cannot compete. Getty Images 2 Alexis Sanchez appeared to have put his hissy fit behind him in training on Wednesday 
“Of course it is a worry. We had periods in the past where we could not financially compete with the bigger clubs who took our players away.” 
Yet Wenger is still confident both Sanchez and record signing Mesut Ozil are looking for more than just hard cash. 
The Frenchman added: “The first target for any professional footballer has to be to play in the best league against the best players. After that you want to play for the maximum amount of money. “At the moment I think the best combination of those factors is in England, so I don’t see why the players should leave the Premier League. 
“I still think most of the big players will stay in Europe.” 
Wenger is not convinced the threat from China will be a long-term problem. 
He added: “You do not create a top league easily. Creating a football culture is a slow process.”
